subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] (unknown)

Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

I would be more than happy to.  The owner signed a discloser with the production company as well as the SciFi channel.  Once it air's I will be more than happy to let you know and see the history and details yourselves!
   
  Thanks for the interest!
   
  Juli

Lisby <lisby@...> wrote:
          Very cool indeed. When you get the OK, maybe you can give us the whole story with the clips!  

  Ann
  
    On Jan 31, 2008, at 7:05 PM, juli velazquez wrote:

          

  Yes it has Ann!  The amazing things are that some of the clips say the full names of the former residents.  This is a famous story as well and once we get the ok, I will be more than happy to share with all of you.  This houses history go's back to the 1800's and has been documents up until the current owner. 
   
  One of the former residents divorced his wife (which is documented in court records) because of abuse from the children.  This took place in the civil war ara and in fact was able to collect his civil war pension.  It is believed that some of the beating may have taken place by the creek with a whip (which is actually mentioned in the clips).
   
  Juli

Lisby <lisby@...> wrote:
      I know you can't disclose the location, but can you summarize the haunting and what you got from the box session? Has any of it checked out in the historic records yet?  

  Ann
  
      On Jan 31, 2008, at 6:43 PM, juli velazquez wrote:

      

  These files are the responses we got when asked if something tragic happened in the home.  The last one clearly reflects that a possible negitive spirit didn't want us asking anymore questions.
   
  Let me know what you think!
   
  Thanks!
  Juli


    The contents of this eletronic correspondence is private & confidential and meant only for the party and/or parties it is addressed to.

<Is this a joke to you, enough.mp3><thomas, trader.mp3><ITS A CRIME.mp3><They are here, they are ready to leave.mp3><whore, they are back, give up.mp3>
